body.p: To his Excellency the Gov. of Ky.

The undersigned Thomas M Crump, humbly petitioners says, he is indicted in the Fleming circuit Court, on a charge of Robing, James C Ahorn, of which Charge he is not, guilty at the time it is said he done, it, he was and continued to be a soldier, in the Union Army as long as the war lasted he is now ^or has been^ Confined, to his room in his fathers house, by reason of one of his testicles , upon it being hurt, while on scout, for fear it may be thought, his affliction is the Effect of, a venereal disease, he, now says it is not, but is as stated he is advised that it will have to be cut out He humbly & Respectfully asks the Gov of the Proud old Comlth of Kentucky to Pardon him

Thomas M. ^his X mark^ Crump
Attest
John Roby
Thos M Crump says the above petition is true

Thomas M ^his x mark^ Crump
Attest John Roby
(Stamp)
Sworn to before me by T M Crump this 15th day of Novr 1865
John Roby J. P. F C

I have Known Tom Crump ever since he was born and his father and mother, and all of his family before him, and in dependant of his affidavit I am Confidant, this petition is true, and if I was Governor of Ky I would pardon him
We hope the Gov. will pardon Tom Crump --

John Roby
